traer.physics
Class AbstractForce

java.lang.Object
  traer.physics.AbstractForce
All Implemented Interfaces:
Force
Direct Known Subclasses:
TargettedForce, UniversalForce
public abstract class AbstractForce
extends java.lang.Object
implements Force

A skeletal implementation of Force covering the methods concerned with the on/off state.

For the typical user wishing to make a custom Force, it is best to extend this class (or one of the other skeletal implementations that meet the custom needs more specifically: TargettedForce, UniversalForce, or TwoBodyForce) and deal only with defining the Force.apply() and Force.apply(Particle) methods.

Since:
4.0
Author:
Carl Pearson, Jeffrey Traer Bernstein

Field Detail

on

private boolean on
For developers: The internal state field; calls to isOn()==on. For small modifications to the on/off behavior in extending classes, the sub-classes should use the methods in this class (e.g., turnOn()), hence this field is private and cannot be accessed directly.

Constructor Detail

AbstractForce

protected AbstractForce()
Default constructor providing an on Force.

For developers: this constructor delegates to AbstractForce(boolean) with a true argument.

AbstractForce

protected AbstractForce(boolean on)
Constructor; the on/off state is set to on

Parameters:
on - the initial state
Method Detail

turnOff

public AbstractForce turnOff()
Description copied from interface: Force
Turns the Force off; after calling this method, calls to Force.isOff() will return true. Implementations of the Force interface should delegate this call to the Force.turnOn(boolean) method, with a false argument.

Specified by:
turnOff in interface Force
Returns:
this Force, de-activated

turnOn

public AbstractForce turnOn()
Description copied from interface: Force
Turns the Force on; after calling this method, calls to Force.isOn() will return true. Implementations of the Force interface should delegate this call to the Force.turnOn(boolean) method, with a true argument.

Specified by:
turnOn in interface Force
Returns:
this Force, activated

turnOn

public AbstractForce turnOn(boolean on)
Description copied from interface: Force
Sets the Force to the argument on. Subsequent calls to Force.isOn() will return the value of on. Implementations of the Force interface should delegate Force.turnOff() and Force.turnOn() to this method.

Specified by:
turnOn in interface Force
Parameters:
on - the state to set the Force in.
Returns:
this Force, with appropriate activation condition

isOn

public boolean isOn()
Description copied from interface: Force
Returns true if this force is on. Will also consistently return !Force.isOff(). Implementations of the Force interface should delegate the behavior of one of these methods to the other, to ensure consistency.

Specified by:
isOn in interface Force
Returns:
true if this force is on

isOff

public boolean isOff()
Description copied from interface: Force
Returns true if this force is off. Will also consistently return !Force.isOn(). Implementations of the Force interface should delegate the behavior of one of these methods to the other, to ensure consistency.

Specified by:
isOff in interface Force
Returns:
true if this force is off
